name: 200.1 - Earthworks methodology  (prior to commencing site works)
Detail of Activity: Prepare earthworks construction methodology suitable for site (eg access, working areas, proximity to slopes, traffic and other site hazards, construction stages proposed)
Comments: Methodology to be provided to Engineer for review prior to commencing excavation on site.
200.2 - Material suitability (prior to bringing fill to site)
Detail of Activity: Confirm imported fill material suitability
Minimum Test Frequency: As per Drawings and Specification
Inspection / Test method: As per Drawings and Specification
Acceptance Criteria: As per Drawings and Specification
Comments: Results to be provided to Engineers Geotechnical Representative for review prior to commencing excavation on site.
Detail of Activity: Set out and mark up of extent of earthworks
Minimum Test Frequency: All earthworks areas
Comments: Treatment area marked up jointly by Contractor and Eng.Rep. Approved by Designer
200.4 - Excavation to formation level (prior to fill placement)
Detail of Activity: Confirm excavations are suitably trimmed and benched.
Minimum Test Frequency: All earthworks areas
Acceptance Criteria: Formation materials in accordance with design assumptions.
Comments: Joint walkover with Contractor and Engineers Geotechincal Representative.
200.5 - Suitability of excavation formation for compaction
Detail of Activity: Confirm the excavated soils are adequate to support construction plant and allow compaction of engineered fill.
Minimum Test Frequency: Test on a on a 10m grid / maximum lineal distance between tests is 10m
Inspection / Test method: Scala Penetrometer (NZS 4402.6.5.2) for cohesionless soil and shear vane test for cohesive soil.
Acceptance Criteria: For approval by Engineer. Where forms Subgrade as per Pavement Design Drawings and ITP
Comments: Results to be provided to Engineers Geotechnical Representative for review prior to filling.
200.6 - Suitability of excavation formation for compaction
Detail of Activity: Confirm the excavated soils are adequate to support construction plant and allow compaction of engineered fill.
Minimum Test Frequency: All earthworks areas
Inspection / Test method: Proof roll or as agreed with Engineer
Acceptance Criteria: Formation soils do not heave and no significant visual deformation under wheel load
Comments: Where the excavation formation soils are not adequate a working platform (SIL Layer)  or undercut of unsuitable soils may be required.   As instructed by Design Engineer.
200.7 - Sediment Controls are in place for the particular section
Minimum Test Frequency: Once per section
Detail of Activity: Density of placed material
Minimum Test Frequency: Unless otherwise in Specification or on Drawings, test every 300mm fill height on a 10m grid
Inspection / Test method: Nuclear Density Meter (NZS 4402:4.2.2 Heavy Compaction) or alternative agreed with Engineer
Acceptance Criteria: Minimum field density of 90% of maximum dry density (MDD) obtained by static compaction for the first 500mm above thestripped and prepared ground surface.
Record documents: IANZ Report & Contractors Report

Comments: Test results to be provided to the Engineers Geotechnical Representative for review. Prelim tests in conjunction with IANZ Lab, compared to Contractors NDM Results, provided results are consistently within 1% of IANZ, acceptance for Contractor to Report NDM's thereafter on mutual agreement. On request by ER
Detail of Activity: Density of placed material
Minimum Test Frequency: Unless otherwise in Specification or on Drawings, test every 300mm fill height on a 10m grid
Inspection / Test method: Nuclear Density Meter (NZS 4402:4.2.2 Heavy Compaction) or alternative agreed with Engineer
Acceptance Criteria: Minimum field density of 98% of maximum dry density (MDD) obtained by vibrating compaction from 500mm above thestripped and prepared ground surface.

Comments: Test results to be provided to the Engineers Geotechnical Representative for review. Prelim tests in conjunction with IANZ Lab, compared to Contractors NDM Results, provided results are consistently within 1% of IANZ, acceptance for Contractor to Report NDM's thereafter on mutual agreement. On request by ER
Detail of Activity: Density of placed material
Minimum Test Frequency: All Engineered Fill at 300mm lifts, 1 Test per 50m2/lift.
Inspection / Test method: Scala Penetrometer (NZS 4402.6.5.2) for cohesionless soil.
Acceptance Criteria: Minimum CBR 10  as correlated against NDM's
Comments: Correlated against NDM's by "in field testing" Witnessed by Engineers Representative and signed off in daily diary
Detail of Activity: Check geometry of the placed fill is in accordance with the design.
Minimum Test Frequency: All earthworks area
Inspection / Test method: Survey, TNZ F/1 1997

Acceptance Criteria: Geometry is in accordance with design drawings (fill surface and batter slope profile, removal of any excess fill).  All points within 30mm of a 3m straight edge with no points above design level. No ponding of water.
Record documents: Suvey, Stringline dips @5 points across carriageway @ 20m spacings
Comments: Joint walkover between Contractor and Engineers Representative.
Acceptance Criteria: CMW Geosience Design approval
Record documents: Certificate in contractor's site folder
Detail of Activity: Orientation and Placing of material
Minimum Test Frequency: Unless otherwise in Specification or on Drawings, each layer of grid
Acceptance Criteria: Gregrid to be placed flat or 1% fall to rear of wall. To be wrinkle free.
Comments: By visor by site Forman/Supervisor.
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with NZTA Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
